page.title: 09Entertainment In Swineshead
page.content: There are 2 fetes held in Swineshead, one by the village hall and the other by the church, both are used to raise money for the respective places. They prove to be successful and happy events, though being run quite differently. The Harvest Supper is held in the Autumn when all the crops have been gathered in. On the Sunday a thanksgiving service is held in the church. Then on the Monday the villagers get together for a supper. This is followed by an auction of all the gifts of fruit, vegetables and groceries. It is not as such a fund raising event but a get together to give thanks for a successful harvest. Every year at Christman the children are invited to a party in the village hall, where they enjoy a tea, games and a present from Father Christmas.
